title: Child Tax Credits when your child reaches 16

details.description: Tax credits for children aged 16 or over - approved education, approved training and when Child Tax Credits stop or continue
details.body:
Child Tax Credits usually stop on 31 August after your child’s 16th birthday but can continue for children under 20 in approved education or training or registered with a careers service.

Approved education

Education must be full-time (more than an average of 12 hours’ supervised study a week during term time) and can include:

  • A levels
  • Scottish Highers
  • NVQ up to level 3

Courses are not approved if they’re:

  • provided by the child’s employer
  • provided through a role the child holds - eg the education is part of their role as a scout leader
  • an advanced course, eg a BTEC Higher National Certificate or Diploma, a higher education course like a university degree

Your child must be accepted onto the course before their 19th birthday.

Approved training

The following training is approved if it’s unpaid:

  • Traineeships
  • Apprenticeships
  • Foundation Learning Programmes (or ‘Entry to Employment’)
  • Get Ready for Work
  • Skillbuild/Skillbuild+ (if started before 1 August 2011)
  • Skillseekers
  • Jobskills
  • Training for Success

Courses that are part of a job contract don’t count as approved courses.

Your child must be accepted for the training before their 19th birthday.

Career services

You can get tax credits for 20 weeks if your child leaves education or  training before they are 18 and:

  • registers with their local careers service or Connexions (or the Education and Library Board in Northern Ireland or similar careers organisation in the European Economic Area, Norway, Switzerland, Iceland or Liechtenstein)
  • joins the Armed Forces

Your child must be 16 or 17, work less than 24 hours a week and not get certain benefits (eg Income Support).

What you need to do

You have to tell the Tax Credit Office if your child:

  • turns 16 and intends to stay on in approved education or training
  • starts or leaves approved education or training
  • joins or leaves a careers service

Tell the Tax Credit Office as soon as possible to make sure you get paid the right amount of tax credits.
